required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Combined Technique of Corneal Remodeling to Treat Ectasia

lead_sponsor.agency: Bambino Gesù Hospital and Research Institute

clinical_study.source: Bambino Gesù Hospital and Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate efficacy, safety, objective and subjective quality of vision after treatment of cornea ectasia with transepithelial topographic guided laser simultaneous Central Corneal Remodeling (CCR) and Cross-linking (CXL).

detailed_description.textblock:
Background To evaluate efficacy, safety, objective and subjective quality of vision after treatment of cornea ectasia performed with transepithelial topographic guided laser simultaneous Central Corneal Remodeling (CCR) and Cross-linking (CXL).
Methods In this retrospective study 8 eyes of 8 patients (mean age 31.50±14.73 years) affected by cornea ectasia underwent simultaneous CCR and CXL. Preoperative and 6 month postoperative uncorrected distance visual acuity (UDVC) and distance corrected visual acuity (DCVA) were measured using the Efficacy and Safety index. Objective and subjective quality of vision were evaluated preoperatively and 6 months postoperatively using corneal morphological irregularity index (CMI), National Eye Institute Visual Function NEI-VFQ25 and NEI-VFQ39 questionnaires.

primary_outcome.description: uncorrected distance visual acuity (UDVC), distance corrected visual acuity (DCVA)
uncorrected distance visual acuity (UDVC), distance corrected visual acuity (DCVA)

intervention.intervention_name: topographic guided trans epithelial excimer laser
intervention.description: In this retrospective study 8 eyes affected by cornea ectasia of 8 patients (mean age 31.50±14.73 years) underwent simultaneous CCR and CXL. Preoperative and 6 month postoperative uncorrected distance visual acuity (UDVC) and distance corrected visual acuity (DCVA) were measured using the Efficacy and Safety index. Objective and subjective quality of vision were respectively evaluated through preoperative and 6 month postoperative corneal morphological irregularity index (CMI), National Eye Institute Visual Function NEI-VFQ25 and NEI-VFQ39 questionnaires.

study_pop.textblock: Eight eyes (2 right and 6 left eyes) of 8 patients, 5 male and 3 female (mean age 31.50±14.73, range 19 to 66 years), affected by cornea ectasia were enrolled in this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- keratoconus with moderate severity (Amsler-Krumeich stage I-II)
Exclusion Criteria:
- concomitant ocular disease
- concomitant systemic disease
- corneal opacities

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Bambino Gesù Hospital and Research Institute
